  <entry>
    <id>tag:github.com,2008:Repository/8077402/v2.5.27</id>
    <updated>2025-11-27T19:20:15Z</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/releases/tag/v2.5.27"/>
    <title>MISP 2.5.27 released with new features and various fixes including security fixes</title>
    <content type="html"><p>This release delivers important new modules, major internal performance optimisations, updates to validation logic, and several security fixes. A large amount of work focused on improving JSON handling, filter pipelines, encoding performance, and overall system robustness.</p>
<h2>🚀 New Features</h2>
<h3>Schema &amp; Modules</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>JSON schema updated</strong> to match the latest 2.5 features.</li>
<li><strong>New workflow module:</strong> <code>flowintel-create-case</code> added. <a href="https://github.com/flowintel/flowintel">flowintel</a></li>
<li><strong>Attribute fetcher pipeline created and reorganised.</strong>
<ul>
<li>Includes early attempts at improving query optimisation.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h2>Changes</h2>
<h3>Internal Improvements</h3>
<ul>
<li>Reworked internal JSON handling:
<ul>
<li>Use <strong>JsonTool</strong> for template generation.</li>
<li>Prefer <strong>SimdJsonBase64Encode</strong> when <code>simdjson_php</code> is available.</li>
<li>Use <code>json_encode</code> native unicode escaping.</li>
<li>Use <code>simdjson_encode_to_stream</code> for events and large arrays.</li>
<li>Use <code>simdjson_encode</code> when the extension is installed.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Optimised handling of <strong>compressed requests</strong>, including <strong>zstd support</strong>.</li>
<li>Use data file for <strong>postsemail background job</strong>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Platform &amp; Pipelines</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Warning-list</strong> updated to the latest version.</li>
<li><strong>Webhook workflow module:</strong> stronger parameter validation.</li>
<li><strong>Index tuning</strong> continues.
<ul>
<li>Working to resolve a major performance bottleneck.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>Filter pipeline:</strong> several iterations and reworks.</li>
</ul>
<h3>CI / Infrastructure</h3>
<ul>
<li>CI added for feature branch workflows.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Fixes</h2>
<h3>Versioning</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixed version string and applied version bump.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Internal</h3>
<ul>
<li>Prevent decoding compressed content twice in error controller.</li>
</ul>
<h3>UI / UX</h3>
<ul>
<li>Updated handling of <code>last_login</code> to use the latest value after <code>_postlogin-&gt;updateLoginTimes</code> (fixes <a class="issue-link js-issue-link" data-error-text="Failed to load title" data-id="3386554143" data-permission-text="Title is private" data-url="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10487" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/MISP/MISP/issues/10487/hovercard" href="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10487">#10487</a>).</li>
</ul>
<h3><a href="https://misp-project.org/security/" rel="nofollow">Security</a> Fixes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Path traversal fixed</strong> in site-admin picture view.
<ul>
<li>Reported during <em>Hack the Government 2025 (Belgium)</em>.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>Reflected XSS</strong> issues fixed in two forms.
<ul>
<li>Reported by an external security researcher.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h3>Other Fixes</h3>
<ul>
<li>Redirect fix for <code>/users/index</code> for all non-siteadmins (fix <a class="issue-link js-issue-link" data-error-text="Failed to load title" data-id="3639238189" data-permission-text="Title is private" data-url="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10543" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/MISP/MISP/issues/10543/hovercard" href="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10543">#10543</a>).</li>
<li><strong>MAC address</strong> validation tightened.</li>
<li><strong>Telfhash</strong> validated as hex-only.</li>
<li>Multiple fixes to tag filter logic and join conditions.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Summary</h2>
<p>This release focuses heavily on internal performance enhancements, validation improvements, new workflow capabilities, and critical security patches. The team continues to push forward on improving scalability, pipeline reliability, and robustness of the 2.5 branch.</p></content>
    <author>
      <name>adulau</name>
    </author>
    <media:thumbnail height="30" width="30" url="https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/3309?s=60&v=4"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>tag:github.com,2008:Repository/8077402/v2.5.26</id>
    <updated>2025-11-20T17:01:47Z</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/releases/tag/v2.5.26"/>
    <title>MISP v2.5.26 released with performance improvements and interoperability fixes</title>
    <content type="html"><h2>MISP v2.5.26 Release Notes (2025-11-20)</h2>
<p>This release brings new features focused on <strong>performance improvements</strong>, <strong>logging enhancements</strong>, and <strong>data standardisation</strong> with the introduction of the UUID attribute type. It also includes several important bug fixes and dependency updates.</p>
<h3>New Features</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Event Linking with UUIDs</strong>: Added an option to prioritize creating event links using <strong>UUIDs</strong> instead of traditional IDs, where possible, improving consistency across distributed systems.</li>
<li><strong>Performance Optimizations</strong>: Introduced new <strong>database indices</strong> to significantly enhance overall MISP performance.</li>
<li><strong>JSON Syslog Support</strong>: A new option allows saving syslog messages in <strong>JSON format</strong> for better logging sanity and easier processing. (Fixes <a class="issue-link js-issue-link" data-error-text="Failed to load title" data-id="3600493474" data-permission-text="Title is private" data-url="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10539" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/MISP/MISP/issues/10539/hovercard" href="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10539">#10539</a>).</li>
<li><strong>UUID Attribute Type</strong>: Added a dedicated <strong>UUID attribute type</strong> to meet requirements from standards like FlowIntel and object templates, offering a better alternative to using text fields for unique identifiers.</li>
</ul>
<h3>⚙️ Changes &amp; Updates</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>misp-stix Improvements</strong>: Updated <code>misp-stix</code> to feature <strong>better STIX 2 input handling</strong>. This update helps prevent issues when loading content or files that might contain an invalid STIX 2 format produced by some non-compliant TIP platforms.</li>
<li><strong>Dependency Bumps</strong>: Updated numerous dependencies, including <strong>PyMISP</strong>, <code>requirements.txt</code>, and the requirement for <strong>taxii client version</strong>.</li>
<li><strong>Object &amp; Data Updates</strong>:
<ul>
<li><strong>misp-object</strong> updated.</li>
<li><strong>warning-lists</strong> updated to the latest version.</li>
<li><strong>misp-taxonomies</strong> updated to the latest version.</li>
<li><strong>misp-galaxy</strong> updated to the latest version.</li>
<li><strong>misp-objects</strong> updated to the latest version.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>Frontend Cleanup</strong>: Removed reference to the non-existing <code>vis.map</code> file in <code>vis.js</code>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>🛠️ Fixes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Security</strong>: Forced <strong>stronger cipher suites</strong> to be set as the default, enhancing security (reported by Jakub Tomaszewski of Zigrin Security).</li>
<li><strong>Attribute Validation</strong>: Added validation for <strong>Attributes of type <code>uuid</code></strong>.</li>
<li><strong>Code Cleanup</strong>: Removed the use of <code>eval</code> from <code>doT.js</code> in favor of <code>globalThis</code>.</li>
<li><strong>UI Fix</strong>: Corrected the event ID link in the <strong>side menu</strong>.</li>
<li><strong>Object Enrichment Fixes</strong>: Several <strong>bugs in object enrichment</strong> have been fixed.</li>
</ul></content>
    <author>
      <name>adulau</name>
    </author>
    <media:thumbnail height="30" width="30" url="https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/3309?s=60&v=4"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>tag:github.com,2008:Repository/8077402/v2.5.25</id>
    <updated>2025-11-16T17:02:06Z</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/releases/tag/v2.5.25"/>
    <title>MISP v2.5.25 Release Notes</title>
    <content type="html"><p><em>(2025-11-12)</em></p>
<p>This release introduces a security fix, significant performance improvements for REST searches, new default feeds, and several important bug fixes.</p>
<h2>Security</h2>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a vulnerability that could expose user passwords in workflows.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Enhancements &amp; Features</h2>
<ul>
<li><strong>New Feeds:</strong> Added three new "hideNseek LAB" Threat Intelligence Feeds (JSON, CSV, and IP Blocklist).</li>
<li><strong>Accessibility:</strong> Significantly improved accessibility for screen reader users when editing server settings. Users can now use an ARIA button to switch cells to edit mode, removing the need to double-click.</li>
<li><strong>STIX:</strong> The <code>misp-stix</code> submodule has been updated to the latest version.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Fixes &amp; Performance</h2>
<ul>
<li><strong>Performance:</strong> Implemented a major performance fix for attribute-level REST searches that use tag filters. This was achieved by moving to a unioned subquery and removing an inefficient join.</li>
<li><strong>REST Search:</strong> Fixed a bug that caused event-level REST searches to fail when searching by tag.</li>
<li><strong>UI (Galaxies):</strong> Added the missing sharing group distribution level to the "quick-relation-add" interface for galaxy clusters.</li>
<li><strong>UI (Relations):</strong> Corrected an issue with editing cluster relations and improved the confirmation text.</li>
<li><strong>UI (Picker):</strong> Restored the correct behavior for the generic UUID picker.</li>
<li><strong>Documentation:</strong> The background jobs migration guide has been updated to include the new scheduler worker.</li>
<li>Fixed a typo in the benchmarks.</li>
</ul>
<h2>🧹 Other</h2>
<ul>
<li>The Mirai tracker project has been discontinued and removed.</li>
</ul></content>
    <author>
      <name>adulau</name>
    </author>
    <media:thumbnail height="30" width="30" url="https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/3309?s=60&v=4"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>tag:github.com,2008:Repository/8077402/v2.5.24</id>
    <updated>2025-11-04T14:35:30Z</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/releases/tag/v2.5.24"/>
    <title>MISP v2.5.24: Security & Stability Update</title>
    <content type="html"><h1>MISP v2.5.24 Release Notes</h1>
<p><strong>Release Date:</strong> 2025-11-03</p>
<p>This release focuses on security enhancements, bug fixes, and minor improvements to stability and functionality.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://vulnerability.circl.lu/vuln/gcve-1-2025-0010" rel="nofollow">GCVE-1-2025-0010</a> &lt; MISP 2.5.24 - Arbitrary file-hash inclusion via templates in the template engine in MispAttribute allows a web user to obtain the MD5 hash of any file accessible to them via inclusion of tmp_name in templates.</li>
<li><a href="https://vulnerability.circl.lu/vuln/gcve-1-2025-0011" rel="nofollow">GCVE-1-2025-0011</a> &lt; MISP 2.5.24 - Invalid check for uploaded file validity in EventsController can lead to arbitrary file inclusion / deletion via import modules by spoofing the tmp_name of the request.</li>
<li><a href="https://vulnerability.circl.lu/vuln/gcve-1-2025-0012" rel="nofollow">GCVE-1-2025-0012</a> &lt; MISP 2.5.24 - Potential vulnerability in file check upload but this vulnerability is non-exploitable as the code is never executed. This vulnerability information is kept for archiving.</li>
<li><a href="https://vulnerability.circl.lu/vuln/gcve-1-2025-0013" rel="nofollow">GCVE-1-2025-0013</a> &lt; MISP 2.5.24 - Authorization bypass / improper access control in app/Controller/SharingGroupBlueprintsController.php in MISP on web application /or API allows an authenticated low-privilege user to inject arbitrary organizations into existing sharing groups (including groups that should not be extendable), thereby granting those organizations access to shared resources and escalating access via crafted sharing-group blueprints or API requests that bypass validation.</li>
<li><a href="https://vulnerability.circl.lu/vuln/gcve-1-2025-0014" rel="nofollow">GCVE-1-2025-0014</a> &lt; MISP 2.5.24 - Cross-site scripting in Mermaid chart rendering component in MISP event report allows a remote attacker part of a MISP community to execute arbitrary JavaScript in the victim’s browser via injection of HTML tags in raw Mermaid charts synchronized through event reports.</li>
<li><a href="https://vulnerability.circl.lu/vuln/gcve-1-2025-0015" rel="nofollow">GCVE-1-2025-0015</a> &lt; MISP 2.5.24 - Cross-site scripting in decaying tool simulation UI/component in MISP on web application allows an attacker/org who can set an organization's display name to execute arbitrary JavaScript in other users' browsers when they view or run simulations via a crafted organization name containing a script payload that is rendered unsanitized when a specific attribute is chosen for the simulation.</li>
<li><a href="https://vulnerability.circl.lu/vuln/gcve-1-2025-0016" rel="nofollow">GCVE-1-2025-0016</a> &lt; MISP 2.5.24 - Local file inclusion in [ImportFromUrl() URL handling component in MISP event report (with pandoc support) on server-side document import feature / web application allows an attacker who can supply a URL to read local filesystem documents and disclose sensitive information (limited to document file types) via providing file:// URLs to ImportFromUrl() that are fetched without proper scheme/host validation.</li>
</ul>
<p>Thanks to Raphael Lob and Jeroen Pinoy from NATO Cyber Security Center for the security evaluation and report.</p>
<h2>Fixes</h2>
<h3>Security</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>jQuery UI Upgrade:</strong> Upgraded <code>jquery-ui</code> used by <code>gridstack</code> to address a security vulnerability (fixes <a class="issue-link js-issue-link" data-error-text="Failed to load title" data-id="3574689120" data-permission-text="Title is private" data-url="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10531" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/MISP/MISP/issues/10531/hovercard" href="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10531">#10531</a>).</li>
<li><strong>Local File Inclusion:</strong> Fixed a local file inclusion vulnerability for document files via <code>importFromUrl()</code>, reported by Jeroes Pinoy.</li>
<li><strong>Decaying Model Tool:</strong> Implemented a speculative fix for an edge case with an unescaped OR name in the decaying model tool, reported by Jeroen Pinoy.</li>
<li><strong>Mermaid Sanitisation:</strong> Improved mermaid sanitisation, maintaining the ability to render mermaid arrows while fixing a security issue, reported by Jeroen Pinoy.</li>
<li><strong>File Validity Check:</strong> Corrected a logic error in file validity checks (non-exploitable), reported by Raphael Lob from NATO Cyber Security Center.</li>
<li><strong>Object File Uploads:</strong> Enhanced sanitisation of the <code>tmp_file</code> name in object file uploads, thanks to Jeroen Pinoy from NATO Cyber Security Center.</li>
<li><strong>Sharing Group Blueprint Access Control:</strong> Tightened access control for sharing group blueprints, thanks to Jeroen Pinoy from NATO Cyber Security Center.</li>
<li><strong>Uploaded File Validity:</strong> Fixed an invalid check for uploaded file validity, thanks to Raphael Lob from NATO Cyber Security Center.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Other Fixes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Publish Process:</strong> Tentative flipping of the publish flag at the start of the publish process to avoid timing issues due to slow server responses.</li>
<li><strong>Publishing:</strong> Moved publishing to separate background processes to prevent congestions caused by unreachable servers in in-line execution.</li>
<li><strong>Users Periodic Summary:</strong> Improved handling of tag filtering and usage of defined variables.</li>
<li><strong>Galaxy Cluster Fetcher:</strong> Corrected association when fetching target clusters from relations.</li>
<li><strong>Workflow Tag After Save:</strong> Ensured correct execution start when an event is tagged (fixes <a class="issue-link js-issue-link" data-error-text="Failed to load title" data-id="3374874930" data-permission-text="Title is private" data-url="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10478" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/MISP/MISP/issues/10478/hovercard" href="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10478">#10478</a>).</li>
<li><strong>Logs Index:</strong> Ignored <code>search_token</code> and empty filters in the logs index.</li>
<li><strong>Cerebrate Pull Sharing Group:</strong> Correctly re-used the <code>extend</code> state set on Cerebrate.</li>
<li><strong>On-Demand Correlation:</strong> Fixed integrity constraint violation when correlating an event with multiple correlating equal value2 attributes (correlations will now show up on a single attribute in these cases, as discussed in <a class="issue-link js-issue-link" data-error-text="Failed to load title" data-id="3519014666" data-permission-text="Title is private" data-url="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10521" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/MISP/MISP/issues/10521/hovercard" href="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10521">#10521</a>).</li>
<li><strong>Logs Index:</strong> Ignored <code>search_token</code> and empty filters in the logs index.</li>
</ul></content>
    <author>
      <name>adulau</name>
    </author>
    <media:thumbnail height="30" width="30" url="https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/3309?s=60&v=4"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>tag:github.com,2008:Repository/8077402/v2.4.216</id>
    <updated>2025-11-04T14:40:09Z</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/releases/tag/v2.4.216"/>
    <title>MISP v2.4.216 Maintenance Release - Security Fixes</title>
    <content type="html"><p><strong><g-emoji class="g-emoji" alias="warning">⚠️</g-emoji> WARNING: This is a maintenance update for the MISP 2.4 series. We strongly recommend all users upgrade to the latest MISP 2.5 series for the most up-to-date features, security patches, and performance improvements.</strong></p>
<p>Thanks to Raphael Lob and Jeroen Pinoy from NATO Cyber Security Center for the security evaluation and report.</p>
<h2>Changes</h2>
<ul>
<li><strong>Version Bump:</strong> Updated the MISP version.</li>
<li><strong>2.5 Upgrade Script:</strong> Added the 2.5 upgrade script directly to the install directory for easier access.</li>
<li><strong>Training Cleanup:</strong> Removed an accidental line from the MISP API/developer workshop that was inadvertently left in a previous commit.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Fixes</h2>
<h3>Security</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>jQuery UI Upgrade:</strong> Upgraded <code>jquery-ui</code> used by <code>gridstack</code> to address a security vulnerability (fixes <a class="issue-link js-issue-link" data-error-text="Failed to load title" data-id="3574689120" data-permission-text="Title is private" data-url="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10531" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/MISP/MISP/issues/10531/hovercard" href="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10531">#10531</a>), as reported by <a class="user-mention notranslate" data-hovercard-type="user" data-hovercard-url="/users/tobmes42/hovercard" data-octo-click="hovercard-link-click" data-octo-dimensions="link_type:self" href="https://github.com/tobmes42">@tobmes42</a>.</li>
<li><strong>Local File Inclusion:</strong> Fixed a local file inclusion vulnerability for document files via <code>importFromUrl()</code>, as reported by Jeroes Pinoy.</li>
<li><strong>Decaying Model Tool:</strong> Implemented a speculative fix for an edge case with an unescaped OR name in the decaying model tool, as reported by Jeroen Pinoy.</li>
<li><strong>Mermaid Sanitisation:</strong> Improved mermaid sanitisation, which now keeps the ability to render mermaid arrows while fixing security issues, as reported by Jeroen Pinoy.</li>
<li><strong>File Validity Check:</strong> Corrected a logic error in file validity checks (non-exploitable, but incorrect), thanks to Raphael Lob from NATO Cyber Security Center.</li>
<li><strong>Object File Uploads:</strong> Enhanced sanitisation of the <code>tmp_file</code> name in object file uploads, thanks to Jeroen Pinoy from NATO Cyber Security Center.</li>
<li><strong>Sharing Group Blueprint Access Control:</strong> Tightened access control for sharing group blueprints, thanks to Jeroen Pinoy from NATO Cyber Security Center.</li>
<li><strong>Uploaded File Validity:</strong> Fixed an invalid check for uploaded file validity, thanks to Raphael Lob from NATO Cyber Security Center.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Other Fixes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Publish Process:</strong> Tentative flipping of the publish flag at the start of the publish process to avoid timing issues due to slow server responses.</li>
<li><strong>Users Periodic Summary:</strong> Improved handling of tag filtering and usage of defined variables.</li>
<li><strong>Workflow Tag After Save:</strong> Ensured correct execution start when an event is tagged (Fixes <a class="issue-link js-issue-link" data-error-text="Failed to load title" data-id="3374874930" data-permission-text="Title is private" data-url="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10478" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/MISP/MISP/issues/10478/hovercard" href="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10478">#10478</a>).</li>
<li><strong>Logs Index:</strong> Ignored <code>search_token</code> and empty filters in the logs index.</li>
<li><strong>Cerebrate Pull Sharing Group:</strong> Correctly re-used the state of <code>extend</code> set on Cerebrate.</li>
<li><strong>Attribute Add:</strong> Adhered to provided tag locality in <code>/attributes/add</code>.</li>
<li><strong>Workflow Editor:</strong> Running a workflow for debugging correctly shows the expected response.</li>
<li><strong>Logs Controller:</strong> Fixed broken named parameters search in the logs controller (fixes <a class="issue-link js-issue-link" data-error-text="Failed to load title" data-id="3235956904" data-permission-text="Title is private" data-url="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10424" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/MISP/MISP/issues/10424/hovercard" href="https://github.com/MISP/MISP/issues/10424">#10424</a>).</li>
<li><strong>Overcorrelating Values:</strong> Chunked the lookup for overcorrelating values to prevent usability issues on large events.</li>
<li><strong>Fetcher Performance:</strong> Addressed a logic bug in the <code>analystdataparentbehavior</code>'s implementation that caused exponentially slower performance as events grew larger.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Other</h2>
<ul>
<li>Various merges from the <code>2.4</code> and <code>2.4-develop</code> branches.</li>
<li>The Mirai tracker project has been discontinued.</li>
</ul></content>
    <author>
      <name>adulau</name>
    </author>
    <media:thumbnail height="30" width="30" url="https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/3309?s=60&v=4"/>
  </entry>

            <title><![CDATA[Arizona AG Sues Temu Over 'Stealing' User Data]]></title>
            <link><![CDATA[https://www.darkreading.com/application-security/arizona-ag-temu-stealing-user-data]]></link>
                        <description><![CDATA[The suit alleges the Chinese retailer's app secretly accesses and harvests users' sensitive information without their knowledge or consent.]]></description>
                                                        <pubDate>Wed, 03 Dec 2025 21:00:58 GMT</pubDate>
                                                                <dc:creator>Alexander Culafi</dc:creator>

                                    </item>        <item>
            <title><![CDATA[The Ransomware Holiday Bind: Burnout or Be Vulnerable]]></title>
            <link><![CDATA[https://www.darkreading.com/cyberattacks-data-breaches/the-ransomware-holiday-bind-burnout-or-be-vulnerable]]></link>
                        <description><![CDATA[Ransomware groups target enterprises during off-hours, weekends, and holidays when security teams are stretched thin and response times lag.]]></description>
                                                        <pubDate>Wed, 03 Dec 2025 13:52:29 GMT</pubDate>
                                                                <dc:creator>Arielle Waldman</dc:creator>
                                    <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[https://www.darkreading.com/cyberattacks-data-breaches/the-ransomware-holiday-bind-burnout-or-be-vulnerable]]></guid>

                                    </item>        <item>
            <title><![CDATA[AI Bolsters Python Variant of Brazilian WhatsApp Attacks]]></title>
            <link><![CDATA[https://www.darkreading.com/cyberattacks-data-breaches/ai-python-variant-brazilian-whatsapp-attacks]]></link>
                        <description><![CDATA[Water Saci has upgraded its self-propagating malware to compromise banks and cryptocurrency exchanges by targeting enterprise users of the popular chat app.]]></description>
                                                        <pubDate>Wed, 03 Dec 2025 10:56:24 GMT</pubDate>
                                                                <dc:creator>Elizabeth Montalbano, Contributing Writer</dc:creator>

                </media:content>
                                    </item>        <item>
            <title><![CDATA[China Researches Ways to Disrupt Satellite Internet]]></title>
            <link><![CDATA[https://www.darkreading.com/cyberattacks-data-breaches/china-researches-ways-disrupt-satellite-internet]]></link>
                        <description><![CDATA[While satellite constellations — such as Starlink — are resilient, 2,000 drones could cut communications to a region the size of Taiwan, researchers find.]]></description>
                                                        <pubDate>Wed, 03 Dec 2025 02:00:00 GMT</pubDate>
                                                                <dc:creator>Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer</dc:creator>
                                    <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[https://www.darkreading.com/cyberattacks-data-breaches/china-researches-ways-disrupt-satellite-internet]]></guid>

            <title><![CDATA[While ECH Adoption Is Low, Risks Remain for Enterprises, End Users]]></title>
            <link><![CDATA[https://www.darkreading.com/data-privacy/while-ech-adoption-is-low-risks-remain-for-enterprises-end-users]]></link>
                        <description><![CDATA[Is the new privacy protocol helping malicious actors more than Internet users?]]></description>
